QAPair.Question: What is (are) Neurologic deficit ?
QAPair.Answer: A neurologic deficit refers to abnormal neurologic function of a body area. This altered function is due to injury of the brain, spinal cord, muscles, or nerves that feed the affected area. Examples include: Abnormal reflexes , Inability to speak, Decreased sensation , Loss of balance, Mental function problems, such as memory loss or difficulty with thought processing, Vision changes, Walking problems, Weakness of the face, arms or legs,
